page.title: 07Odell Great Wood
page.content: Odell Great Wood, is designated by the Nature Conservancy Council as a site of Special Scientific Interest. It is a large (85.1 hectares) and mostly unspoilt example of wet Ash-Maple Woodland with an exceptionally rich flora. It is in many respects the best example in Bedfordshire of this type of woodland, which has become increasingly scarce throughout southern and eastern England. The dominant tree species are Ash and Oak over a well-developed shrub layer of Hazel, Field Maple, Dogwood and Privet. There are several rare flowers to be found in the Wood such as Wild Daffodil and Herb Paris. The extensive and well-developed system of rides is another important feature, adding to the value of the site for flowering plants, butterflies and other invertebrates.
